communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Clandestine Services Historical Paper No. 34, "Southeast Asia Communications Activity and Its Support to Vietnam, 1951-1964". Do not provide the previously processed copy from CIA-RDP84-00499R0008001 00004-4, please conduct a new review of the document.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Island Thunder 12

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Island Thunder 12
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of the FBI's participation in "ISLAND THUNDER 12", a joint tabletop exercise conducted with the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) in Hawaii on March 29, 2012. The scope of this request is to prioritize briefing materials and/or workbooks provided to participating agencies and any interim and/or final reports or post-mortems written after the exercise was concluded.

Paul Galante

title: Somerset County Weekend Incarceration Fees

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically: 

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

title: Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records (Department of Health and Human Services, Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Officers
Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records

Dear Freedom of Information Officers,

I am writing to formally request access to all records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) and relevant Connecticut state laws, specifically related to the Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. This information is critical to my participation in the oversight and administration of this program.

In accordance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I am requesting accommodations due to my condition. I respectfully request that all records be provided electronically via email, as opposed to portals or complex delivery methods, to ensure full and equal access to the information.

Scope of Request:
Legislative Records:

All bills, amendments, resolutions, legislative proposals, and legislative history related to the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Voting records of all state and federal legislators on any legislation affecting the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Minutes, transcripts, and audio/video recordings of meetings, hearings, or discussions where the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program was a topic.
Public Records:

Comprehensive reports, studies, assessments, and evaluations on the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Budget allocations, financial statements, expenditure reports, and audit results related to the program, pursuant to Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66 and related sections).
All contracts, agreements, memoranda of understanding, and intergovernmental agreements involving the administration or management of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Correspondence:

All emails, letters, and other forms of communication, including internal and external, regarding the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Internal memoranda, briefing documents, policy directives, and decision-making correspondence related to the oversight and implementation of the program.
Personnel Records:

Non-confidential employment records, including job descriptions, resumes, and performance evaluations, of individuals involved in the administration and oversight of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program. This request is consistent with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a), which protects confidential personal data.
Organizational charts detailing the structure and personnel responsible for managing the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program within relevant state and federal agencies.
Program Information:

All guidelines, protocols, procedural documents, and compliance reviews governing the operation of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, as mandated by Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) for home and community-based services waiver programs.
Implementation plans, performance metrics, outcome reports, and evaluation summaries regarding the effectiveness of the program.
Comprehensive data sets related to enrollment, utilization, demographic information, and outcomes of beneficiaries participating in the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Special Requests:
Expedited Processing: Pursuant to Executive Order 13392, which mandates the improvement of agency disclosure processes, and the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request expedited processing of this FOIA request due to the public interest and personal impact of the information.

Electronic Records: In compliance with my rights under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the ADA, I request that all records be provided in electronic format and sent directly to my email address. This will ensure that I can access the information without unnecessary barriers or delays.

Fee Waiver Request:
I request a waiver of all fees associated with this FOIA request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). This request is made in the public interest and not for commercial use. The disclosure of the requested information will significantly contribute to public understanding of government operations, particularly concerning the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, which impacts a vulnerable population. Additionally, due to my condition, as covered by Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, a fee waiver will ensure equitable access to this important information.

Relevant Laws:
This FOIA request, and the accommodations I am requesting, are governed by the following laws and regulations:

Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) – Governing the right to request access to federal records.
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.) – Ensuring equal access for individuals with disabilities, including in communication.
Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) – Prohibiting discrimination based on disability in programs receiving federal funding.
Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a) – Protecting personal privacy in records maintained by federal agencies.
Medicaid Statute (Title XIX of the Social Security Act) (42 U.S.C. § 1396 et seq.) – Governing Medicaid programs, including waivers like the ABI Waiver.
Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. §§ 1-200 to 1-242) – Governing the right to request access to state records.
Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66) – Requiring public disclosure of state budget allocations and financial reports.
CMS Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) – Governing the administration of home and community-based services waiver programs, including the ABI Waiver.
Executive Order 13392 ("Improving Agency Disclosure of Information") – Mandating federal agencies to improve FOIA processing.
Non-Waiver of Rights:
This request does not waive any rights I may have under FOIA, the ADA, the Rehabilitation Act, or any other applicable law, and I reserve all rights regarding this matter.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this request and for accommodating my needs.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources

Departments of Submission:
State of Connecticut Agencies:
Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
Email: foia.dss@ct.gov
Department: Department of Social Services

Connecticut Office of the Attorney General

Department: Office of the Attorney General

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Officers
Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records

Dear Freedom of Information Officers,

I am writing to formally request access to all records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) and relevant Connecticut state laws, specifically related to the Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. This information is critical to my participation in the oversight and administration of this program.

In accordance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I am requesting accommodations due to my condition. I respectfully request that all records be provided electronically via email, as opposed to portals or complex delivery methods, to ensure full and equal access to the information.

Scope of Request:
Legislative Records:

All bills, amendments, resolutions, legislative proposals, and legislative history related to the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Voting records of all state and federal legislators on any legislation affecting the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Minutes, transcripts, and audio/video recordings of meetings, hearings, or discussions where the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program was a topic.
Public Records:

Comprehensive reports, studies, assessments, and evaluations on the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Budget allocations, financial statements, expenditure reports, and audit results related to the program, pursuant to Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66 and related sections).
All contracts, agreements, memoranda of understanding, and intergovernmental agreements involving the administration or management of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Correspondence:

All emails, letters, and other forms of communication, including internal and external, regarding the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Internal memoranda, briefing documents, policy directives, and decision-making correspondence related to the oversight and implementation of the program.
Personnel Records:

Non-confidential employment records, including job descriptions, resumes, and performance evaluations, of individuals involved in the administration and oversight of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program. This request is consistent with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a), which protects confidential personal data.
Organizational charts detailing the structure and personnel responsible for managing the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program within relevant state and federal agencies.
Program Information:

All guidelines, protocols, procedural documents, and compliance reviews governing the operation of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, as mandated by Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) for home and community-based services waiver programs.
Implementation plans, performance metrics, outcome reports, and evaluation summaries regarding the effectiveness of the program.
Comprehensive data sets related to enrollment, utilization, demographic information, and outcomes of beneficiaries participating in the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Special Requests:
Expedited Processing: Pursuant to Executive Order 13392, which mandates the improvement of agency disclosure processes, and the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request expedited processing of this FOIA request due to the public interest and personal impact of the information.

Electronic Records: In compliance with my rights under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the ADA, I request that all records be provided in electronic format and sent directly to my email address. This will ensure that I can access the information without unnecessary barriers or delays.

I request a waiver of all fees associated with this FOIA request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). This request is made in the public interest and not for commercial use. The disclosure of the requested information will significantly contribute to public understanding of government operations, particularly concerning the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, which impacts a vulnerable population. title: Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records (Office Of Policy And Management)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Officers
Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records

Dear Freedom of Information Officers,

I am writing to formally request access to all records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) and relevant Connecticut state laws, specifically related to the Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. This information is critical to my participation in the oversight and administration of this program.

In accordance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I am requesting accommodations due to my condition. I respectfully request that all records be provided electronically via email, as opposed to portals or complex delivery methods, to ensure full and equal access to the information.

Scope of Request:
Legislative Records:

All bills, amendments, resolutions, legislative proposals, and legislative history related to the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Voting records of all state and federal legislators on any legislation affecting the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Minutes, transcripts, and audio/video recordings of meetings, hearings, or discussions where the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program was a topic.
Public Records:

Comprehensive reports, studies, assessments, and evaluations on the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Budget allocations, financial statements, expenditure reports, and audit results related to the program, pursuant to Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66 and related sections).
All contracts, agreements, memoranda of understanding, and intergovernmental agreements involving the administration or management of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Correspondence:

All emails, letters, and other forms of communication, including internal and external, regarding the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Internal memoranda, briefing documents, policy directives, and decision-making correspondence related to the oversight and implementation of the program.
Personnel Records:

Non-confidential employment records, including job descriptions, resumes, and performance evaluations, of individuals involved in the administration and oversight of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program. This request is consistent with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a), which protects confidential personal data.
Organizational charts detailing the structure and personnel responsible for managing the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program within relevant state and federal agencies.
Program Information:

All guidelines, protocols, procedural documents, and compliance reviews governing the operation of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, as mandated by Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) for home and community-based services waiver programs.
Implementation plans, performance metrics, outcome reports, and evaluation summaries regarding the effectiveness of the program.
Comprehensive data sets related to enrollment, utilization, demographic information, and outcomes of beneficiaries participating in the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Special Requests:
Expedited Processing: Pursuant to Executive Order 13392, which mandates the improvement of agency disclosure processes, and the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request expedited processing of this FOIA request due to the public interest and personal impact of the information.

Electronic Records: In compliance with my rights under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the ADA, I request that all records be provided in electronic format and sent directly to my email address. This will ensure that I can access the information without unnecessary barriers or delays.

Fee Waiver Request:
I request a waiver of all fees associated with this FOIA request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). This request is made in the public interest and not for commercial use. The disclosure of the requested information will significantly contribute to public understanding of government operations, particularly concerning the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, which impacts a vulnerable population. Additionally, due to my condition, as covered by Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, a fee waiver will ensure equitable access to this important information.

Relevant Laws:
This FOIA request, and the accommodations I am requesting, are governed by the following laws and regulations:

Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) – Governing the right to request access to federal records.
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.) – Ensuring equal access for individuals with disabilities, including in communication.
Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) – Prohibiting discrimination based on disability in programs receiving federal funding.
Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a) – Protecting personal privacy in records maintained by federal agencies.
Medicaid Statute (Title XIX of the Social Security Act) (42 U.S.C. § 1396 et seq.) – Governing Medicaid programs, including waivers like the ABI Waiver.
Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. §§ 1-200 to 1-242) – Governing the right to request access to state records.
Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66) – Requiring public disclosure of state budget allocations and financial reports.
CMS Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) – Governing the administration of home and community-based services waiver programs, including the ABI Waiver.
Executive Order 13392 ("Improving Agency Disclosure of Information") – Mandating federal agencies to improve FOIA processing.
Non-Waiver of Rights:
This request does not waive any rights I may have under FOIA, the ADA, the Rehabilitation Act, or any other applicable law, and I reserve all rights regarding this matter.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this request and for accommodating my needs.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros

I respectfully request that all records be provided electronically via email, as opposed to portals or complex delivery methods, to ensure full and equal access to the information.

Scope of Request:
Legislative Records:

All bills, amendments, resolutions, legislative proposals, and legislative history related to the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Voting records of all state and federal legislators on any legislation affecting the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Minutes, transcripts, and audio/video recordings of meetings, hearings, or discussions where the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program was a topic.
Public Records:

Comprehensive reports, studies, assessments, and evaluations on the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Budget allocations, financial statements, expenditure reports, and audit results related to the program, pursuant to Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66 and related sections).
All contracts, agreements, memoranda of understanding, and intergovernmental agreements involving the administration or management of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Correspondence:

All emails, letters, and other forms of communication, including internal and external, regarding the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Internal memoranda, briefing documents, policy directives, and decision-making correspondence related to the oversight and implementation of the program.
Personnel Records:

Non-confidential employment records, including job descriptions, resumes, and performance evaluations, of individuals involved in the administration and oversight of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program. This request is consistent with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a), which protects confidential personal data.
Organizational charts detailing the structure and personnel responsible for managing the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program within relevant state and federal agencies.
Program Information:

All guidelines, protocols, procedural documents, and compliance reviews governing the operation of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, as mandated by Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) for home and community-based services waiver programs.
Implementation plans, performance metrics, outcome reports, and evaluation summaries regarding the effectiveness of the program.
Comprehensive data sets related to enrollment, utilization, demographic information, and outcomes of beneficiaries participating in the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Special Requests:
Expedited Processing: Pursuant to Executive Order 13392, which mandates the improvement of agency disclosure processes, and the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request expedited processing of this FOIA request due to the public interest and personal impact of the information.

Electronic Records: In compliance with my rights under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the ADA, I request that all records be provided in electronic format and sent directly to my email address. This will ensure that I can access the information without unnecessary barriers or delays.

I request a waiver of all fees associated with this FOIA request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). This request is made in the public interest and not for commercial use. The disclosure of the requested information will significantly contribute to public understanding of government operations, particularly concerning the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, which impacts a vulnerable population. Additionally, due to my condition, as covered by Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, a fee waiver will ensure equitable access to this important information.

Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a) – Protecting personal privacy in records maintained by federal agencies.

Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66) – Requiring public disclosure of state budget allocations and financial reports.
CMS Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) – Governing the administration of home and community-based services waiver programs, including the ABI Waiver.
Executive Order 13392 ("Improving Agency Disclosure of Information") – Mandating federal agencies to improve FOIA processing.
Non-Waiver of Rights:
This request does not waive any rights I may have under FOIA, the ADA, the Rehabilitation Act, or any other applicable law, and I reserve all rights regarding this matter.

title: Prostitution Related Cases, 2022-present

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Prostitution Related Cases, 2022-present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Charging documents, including criminal complaints, police affidavits, or other narratives including police reports, filed by your office in all cases of:

11-67.1 Human Trafficking
11-34.1-7. Pandering or permitting prostitution
11-34.1-2. Prostitution
11-34.1-3. Procurement of sexual conduct for a fee.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request - 10/16/24
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Mr. Nash,

Ms. Baker shared your email with me since it involves a records request and I serve as the school division’s FOIA Compliance Specialist. As such, I am writing to acknowledge receipt of your request for records made pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (the Act).

As I am sure you are aware, the Act requires “reasonable specificity,” which is outlined in § 2.2-3704 (B) of the Code of Virginia<https://law.lis.virginia.gov/vacode/title2.2/chapter37/section2.2-3704/>. With regard to your request for “any and all communication”, we ask that you please specify what type of “communication” you are requesting, such as emails.

Additionally, please further narrow your request, such as providing specific individuals or groups of individuals and providing a date range, so we can better assess and respond to your records request.

Providing greater specificity will help us better assess and respond to your records request and most likely help to reduce the number of records and the amount of time that our staff will need to search for, review, and possibly redact portions of these records. This will likely provide you with a cost savings, if applicable.

Upon your further clarification regarding the additional requested information above, we will work to determine what records exist and are responsive to your request, as well as an estimate of any costs that may be associated with your request.
Regards,
Rebecca Holbrook
Communications Specialist- FOIA Compliance
Hanover County Public Schools
rholbrook@hcps.us

title: Incoming Phone and Fax Records: Sept 1-Oct 5 2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Inbound phone and fax records for (573) 751-3222 and (573) 751-1495, respectively, for the date range indicated below.

Start Date: 12:00 AM September 1, 2024
End Date: 11:59 PM October 5, 2024

The information requested from these records are the following:

(1) A timestamp indicating the time and date of the inbound call

(2) An indication of how the call or fax was handled, with the following categorizations. Additional categorizations or details are acceptable to include.

    Phone Call:
        (2a) Answered by a live person.
        (2b) Directed to voicemail with a message successfully recorded.
        (2c) Directed to voicemail with no message recorded due to a full voice mailbox.
        (2d) Directed to voicemail, but caller hung up or opted not to record a message.
        (2e) Directed to an extension and answered by a live person.
        (2f) Directed to an extension and answered by voicemail with a message successfully recorded. 
        (2g) Directed to an extension, answered by voicemail, but no message recorded due to a full voicemail box.
        (2h) Directed to an extension, answered by voicemail, but caller hung up or opted not to record a message.
        (2i) Directed to and answered by a live operator.
        (2j) Directed to an operator, but not answered.
        (2k) Call not answered by live person nor voicemail.
        (2l) Other: Please specify
        
    Fax:
        (2m) Received and job printed successfully at the time of reception.
        (2n) Received but job not printed due to empty paper source.
        (2o) Received but job not printed due to other reason - please specify.
        (2p) Call not answered.
        (2q) Other: Please specify
        
(3) A privacy-preserving, unique identifier derived from the caller's telephone number. 

    This identifier shall establish a 1:1 mapping to the source phone number and remain the same for all instances of the source phone number appearing in the inbound call log. 
    
    A clarification: the requester is specifically NOT requesting a new record to be created, but rather, to merely provide the existing information in a different representation. The suggested way to achieve this is to use an HMAC cryptographic operation. The Python (https://www.python.org) script provided below demonstrates how to represent phone numbers as privacy-preserving unique identifiers via HMAC-SHA256.
    
    To preserve the privacy of callers, the requester specifically requests that if HMAC or a similar cryptographic scheme is used to satisfy this request, that the secret key is NOT disclosed in any response or public records, to the extent permitted by law.
    

Example Python Script:

~~~
#!/usr/bin/env python3
#
# An example showing how to represent a log of phone numbers as
# privacy-preserving unique identifiers using HMAC-SHA256.
#
# Below is the expected example output:
# 
# Timestamp: 2024-09-07 11:07:55, Status: 2b, Source: 37946e67b0fb1a193350c3f6f228f08df6e1078606a9617578d05868d9c203cc
# Timestamp: 2024-09-10 23:59:12, Status: 2c, Source: 4f6dde6cf83ca4311ad66c8f97616682bd08848a383e7b23b032d602e3d7105d
# Timestamp: 2024-09-15 13:00:35, Status: 2a, Source: ea558425ccced1be9f084efd9df45ae39343e138494a611a0c28877a9bb86f43
# Timestamp: 2024-09-15 20:32:07, Status: 2g, Source: 37946e67b0fb1a193350c3f6f228f08df6e1078606a9617578d05868d9c203cc
#
################################################################################
import hashlib
import hmac

# An example list containing the raw requested information
data = [
    {'ts': '2024-09-07 11:07:55', 'status': '2b', 'caller': '555-123-4567'},
    {'ts': '2024-09-10 23:59:12', 'status': '2c', 'caller': '555-555-0001'},
    {'ts': '2024-09-15 13:00:35', 'status': '2a', 'caller': '555-555-9876'},
    {'ts': '2024-09-15 20:32:07', 'status': '2g', 'caller': '555-123-4567'},
]

# IMPORTANT: Replace this value with a secret string of random words
# and DO NOT disclose this secret.
secret = "willow dog forbearance hiccup nonsense ant index".encode('UTF-8')

# Iterate over the raw data record and print it in the requested representation
for entry in data:
    source = entry['caller'].encode('UTF-8')
    privacy_id = hmac.digest(secret, source, hashlib.sha256).hex()

    output = 'Timestamp: {:s}, Status: {:s}, Source: {:s}'
    print(output.format(entry['ts'], entry['status'], privacy_id))
~~~

The requester of this information is willing to provide pro bono technical education and assistance with respect to this request, in a manner consistent with any specified IT restrictions and limitations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

bca0cfff68b6fb1c46a04f0764ba6e68f0449f7ea5b01db3e53a96b1c1cba194

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I am requesting records related to any potential communications, negotiations, or discussions between AI companies and the operators of Indian Point Nuclear Power Plant, specifically concerning the use of its nuclear energy to power AI, cloud computing, or data center operations.

I am particularly interested in any interactions involving the following companies: Microsoft, Google, OpenAI, Amazon, X, NVIDIA, or other relevant AI companies. 

Specifically, I request the following public records:

Regulatory filings, proposals, or correspondence involving Indian Point's energy allocation or potential deals related to AI or data centers, submitted to or reviewed by the Department of Public Service or the New York State Public Service Commission, or the city government of Peekskill.

Emails, meeting notes, or memoranda between New York State agencies (including the Department of Public Service, NYSERDA, Peekskill city, or other relevant entities) and representatives from Microsoft, Google, OpenAI, Amazon, NVIDIA, or other AI companies about the possibility of using Indian Point's facilities for AI purposes.
Records of any discussions or agreements with AI companies on energy procurement from Indian Point, especially in the context of Indian Point's decommissioning and energy redistribution.
Records of any environmental impact assessments, energy allocation studies, or reviews that involve proposals by AI companies to use nuclear power from Indian Point for data centers or AI projects.
I request records from January 2020 to the present. If there are any fees associated with the provision of these records, please inform me in advance. If possible, I would prefer the records in digital format via email.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: RE: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana State Senate FOIA 10.15.24
communications.communication:
Dear Victoria:

I have received this request.


Our process is to ask the member(s) to review their records for records which may apply to this request. In addition, we ask the legislature's computer center staff to run a search of the legislative email accounts of the person or persons, if any, to locate any emails in those accounts that are responsive to the request. The computer staff segregates the person's mailboxes, runs the search inquiries using the terms or information you supplied covering the request period and provides those search results to me. The computer searches are run by a joint (House and Senate) computer staff and can only be run one-at-a-time and in the order received. There are currently several Senate searches that pre-date this one for the Senate alone. I do not know how many House of Representatives searches are currently in the queue.



Following the computer staff's segregation of emails, and the person’s segregation of records, I then must review the email located within the mailboxes which are identified using the search terms you provided to: (1) remove all non-public records, i.e. e-mails that have nothing to do with conducting the public's business, and (2) identify the emails that are protected speech under our constitutional privilege contained in LA Constitution Art. III, § 8. After identification of any privileged e-mails, if any, I discuss each privileged record with any person or associated member to ascertain whether that member will waive or assert the privilege on each identified record. If the member asserts this privilege, I must then remove those from the documents from other records that could be produced. This process results in a set of records which is then made available for inspection and copying.



The Senate charges $0.25 per page for copies plus the cost of shipping. The charge applies whether records are reproduced and mailed, downloaded, or emailed (minus the cost of mailing).



Sincerely,



Yolanda Dixon
Secretary of the Senate
225-342-6184
dixony@legis.la.gov
